channel.title: A Quick Question
channel.description: Now, I recently became a YouTube Director :P But all of my RuneScape Videos don't have music because HyperCam doesn't record the sound for some reason! Anyway, I have Windows Movie Maker which I know is for Video Editing and whatnot... So, I'll get to the point, I can add music to my Video but I can't upload it onto YouTube because it says it's an invalid Format. If anyone knows how to convert or if you have any ideas post here... ;D Edit: I've just searched for "Camtasia" on Google and well... It's $298.95 All that just to record and post Videos?

item.title: A Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“NickMoran06, post:6, topic:28662”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=42292.msg516790#msg516790 date=1164411733]

Erm… HyperCam converts it into AVI. Then Windows Movie Maker converts it into… .MSWMM which is an invalid YouTube Format. Now, from Windows Movie Maker, there is a way to re-format and keep it AVI Format but how?

Just use Camtasia. Camtasia gives audio from say whatever you can hear with speakers + .avi formats.
[/quote]
Dude! I’m not paying $300! I’m not even American![/quote]

Its sad that your saying that in a “Hacking” Forum…

Read full topic

Dude! I’m not paying $300! I’m not even American!
[/quote]

There’s a 30 day free trial, or you can just get a cracked version.[/quote]
Thanks to BobDole81. Where’s the cracked version? Link to it please?

Read full topic

item.title: A Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Use Camtasia.

While setting up for your video, on Recording Options select Record Audio, on next page select your sound driver then on Audio Input Sources, select Manual Input Selection then Stereo Mix. But that’s for me, might be different for you.

Read full topic
